content.description: Start as if for One Bag Face then continue up the crack system to the top
content.location: Left side of the block buttress

content.description: This one has some soft rock but is otherwise a fun romp up a series of corners and roofs
content.location: This climb and its neighbor, Scrawny Ruffian's Route sit above and apart from the main wall of the crag. Basically they're right below Just Send It

content.description: Climb the cool overhanging face up the "Titanic" feature. Gear is found in horizontals
content.location: Travel climber's right along the old mining road until you encounter the ship's prow of the Titanic feature

content.description: The roof sequence on this climb is awesome! Everything else is good enough I guess. Climb up the arete to a good stance under the roof. Dangle and swing out left, then commit to the sequence as good-enough holds materialize just as you start to think about pitching off.
content.location: Directly below Just Send it Wall is this climb and its neighbor Triple Trash

climbs.name: Reservations and Mild Life
climbs.fa: Brooks Wenzel, Matt Carpenter, Lindsay Hermanns

content.description: On the wall to the right of the main buttress is this good line up some cracks with an extra challenge on top
This climb's name is an allusion to another route up above, which also turns out to be easier than it might look. It's a fun set of crack roof things.
content.location: Walk along the old mining bench right of the main block

climbs.name: One Bag Face
climbs.fa: Matt Carpenter, Lindsay Hermanns, Brooks Wenzel

content.description: Just like its big brother up above, start on the right side of the block then work your way up and left around the arete to a mantle on top.
content.location: on the right side of the main block buttress

content.description: Start in the chimney on the left side of the block buttress. Work your way out right and then zigzag your way up the clean face.
content.protection: standard, a bit tricky to place
content.location: It's the block that you can see from the bridge, dude

content.description: The companion (left) route of Spring Line, another fun and exciting romp up the overhang, but take the left line through a tiny right facing dihedral feature with cool holds and good but hidden gear
content.location: Take the miner's road climber's right for a few minutes until you encounter the Titanic, a large "ship's prow" feature with an overhanging wall on the left side. Find these two routes on the overhang.

content.description: Another bit of a misnomer, you won't be bored one bit on this rig! This is the first climb on the left side of the main block. Climb through the overhang, committing to moves and praying for gear in horizontals
content.location: It's on the left side of the One Bag Face block

content.description:
You ever hike out in the woods away from everyone and dig yourself a cat hole just to find out that all you really needed to do was fart? Yeah, me either.

This climb was originally done as a downclimb on sight free solo. In fact, I don't think anyone ever actually ascended, so it's more accurate to say Brooks and I got the FD on this one.
content.location: The chimney on the right side of the One Bag Face block
